metadata.title: USN-7227-1 -- PCL vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that PCL incorrectly handled certain malformed files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly exploit this to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7227-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libpcl-apps1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-common1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-dev - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-doc - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-features1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-filters1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-io1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-kdtree1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-keypoints1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-octree1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-outofcore1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-people1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-recognition1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-registration1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-sample-consensus1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-search1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-segmentation1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-surface1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-tracking1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl-visualization1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 libpcl1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 pcl-tools - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
